column4: i'm trying to upgrade an 8.04 desktop to 10.04, and do-release-upgrade is saying no new release found.  i've gone into software sources and changed "never" to "LTS" - is there anything else i'm missing?
Which apt mirror are you using?
osuosl
Try using the main mirror.
will do, thanks!
You're welcome.
any other ideas? didn't work :(
Software Sources may have already done this, but try step2, "edit /etc/update-manager/release-upgrades and set Prompt=normal", from http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/upgrade
i don't want normal, i want LTS -> LTS :/
Sorry, meant to post the 8.04 to 10.04 instructions, basically replace "normal" with "lts"
yeah it's already set to lts
I assume you ran "sudo apt-get update" after changing mirrors?
sudo do-release-upgrade --devel-release ended
Be *absolutely* sure that isn't going to upgrade you to 10.10. It shouldn't, but --devel-release also shouldn't be needed.
says lucid all over it, but mucho thanks for the warning
NVM, that is in the official instructions. That's really odd. Maybe they're only upgrading servers LTS to LTS after 10.04.1 ?
Actually I believe that with PAM it should.
if you use passwd it definietly doesn't change it
Did you run passwd as root or as the user whose password you were changing?
as the user, that might have done it :)

When changing the password using just "passwd", running as the user whose password is being changed, PAM should cause the password for the encrypted home directory to be changed to. This doesn't happen when you use passwd as root because you are never prompted for the user's password, which is required to make the change.
